examples: Despite advancing age, his mind was still as sharp as ever.

definitions.definition: The ability to be aware of things.
examples: There was no doubt in his mind that they would win.

definitions.definition: The ability to focus the thoughts.
examples: I can’t keep my mind on what I’m doing.

definitions.definition: Somebody that embodies certain mental qualities.
examples: He was one of history’s greatest minds .
He changed his mind after hearing the speech.
She had a mind to go to Paris.
I have half a mind to do it myself.
I am of a mind to listen.
I, ______ being of sound mind and body, do hereby [ … ]

definitions.definition: The non- material substance or set of processes in which consciousness , perception , affectivity , judgement , thinking , and will are based.
examples: The nature of the mind is a major topic in philosophy.

definitions.definition: Continual prayer on a dead person's behalf for a period after their death.
examples: a month's [or monthly] mind ; a year's mind

secondary_definitions: The ability to be aware of things.
The ability to focus the thoughts.
Somebody that embodies certain mental qualities.
( philosophy ) The non- material substance or set of processes in which consciousness , perception , affectivity , judgement , thinking , and will are based.
